alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 19 at 6:59PM PST until January 21 at 9:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM PST SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet are expected. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From early Saturday through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Strong rip currents leading to hazardous swimming conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Swell and surf will peak Saturday night.
info.instruction: Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore...which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins...jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards...beach patrol flags and signs.
